hanzi-su-wiki:
岡

Значения

Холм, возвышенность

Мнемоника

Упрощено. Горный 山 перевал, словно сетью 网, покрытый облаками. Позднее — холм или возвышенность.

Варианты

冈, 堽, 崗
purpleculture_pinyin:
gāng
ridge; mound
гребень; курган

  • RS. A net of clouds over a mountain 山

(Simplified: 冈)
Pictographic: Clouds 网 forming over a mountain 山

heisig_chinese_memo: Looks like a mountain goat standing on the ridge of a hill. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: mount, glass canopy, hood, mountain goat, horns, mountain
heisig_story: Here we see a mountain goat "mounted" under a glass canopy. In this and the following frames, think of a particular Mount you know.
koohiiStory1: White mount , Fuji mount , olympus mount whatever ....The choice is yours but wherever you go they sell those snowglobe souvenir : under a GLASS HOOD you can see the mount with a MOUTAIN GOAT standing on top of it .... So kitsch you just can´t forget it .
koohiiStory2: This has the same meaning as 丘, so my "Mount" is a hill with mountain goats on it under a glass canopy. It´s obviously an effort by the locals to add some Mount atmosphere to their hill. As a primitive, it has the meaning "sturdy" (really), which Heisig has not used for some reason, but I will. The glass canopy must be pretty sturdy to keep the goats inside (bulletproof glass, I´m sure).
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You have a scene going on inside your head. It is of a pair of horns on the ground atop a mountain. No. It is not just one pair of horns. It is many. So many that they create a giant hill atop the mountain, which is already pretty high.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this hill of horns on top of this mountain. This hill of horns makes it possible for you to get just high enough to touch the top of the sky.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: How was standing atop this hill of horns on top of a mountain to touch the sky? Eh. It was okay (おか), but that's about it.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Feel indifferent about this hill of horns on top of the mountain. It's all in your head anyways.
Ru_Notes: Фонетик для ряда кандзи: 鋼 (はがね、コウ сталь), 綱 (つな、コウ трос), 剛 (ゴウ крепкий, прочный, сильный).
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), 并, 冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 山 (гора), 岡 (холм)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the wide (冂) grass (䒑) mountain (山) is just a hill
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: At the ridge of a hill there is a memorial statue of wolverine with a glass cover around it.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " mountain " to " net " sound. The original meaning is ridge. "Shuowen": "Oka, mountain bones. From the mountain, net sound." Such as "Poetry. Zhou Nan. "Round Ears": "Zhibi Gaogang, I Ma Xuanhuang." "Mao Zhuan": "The ridge is called Gang." "Zuo Zhuan. "The Thirty-one Years of Zhao Gong": "The Master of Chu moved to Nangang and returned." "Selected Works. Zhang Pingzi's "Sixuan Fu": "The past dreams are in the wood and the high hills of Kunlun." See " Gang ".

" Gang " refers to mountains and hills by extension. Such as "The Songs of the Chu. Nine thinking. "Sorrowful Years": "Zhi Yuluan is happy, and you can see the gaogangs and ridges." Hong Xingzu's supplementary note: "The mountains are like the hills." "Selected Works. Chen Kongzhang's "Commemorative Songs from General Wu's Department": "Gai Feng Ming Gao Gang, far away and Luo, virtuous and saintly virtue." Liu Liang's note: "Oka, mountain."
humanum_short_description_en: From " mountain " to " net " sound. The original meaning is ridge.
humanum_full_description:
從「山」，「网」聲。本義是山脊。《說文》：「岡，山骨也。从山，网聲。」如《詩．周南．卷耳》：「陟彼高岡，我馬玄黃。」《毛傳》：「山脊曰岡。」《左傳．昭公三十一年》：「楚師遷潛於南岡而還。」《文選．張平子〈思玄賦〉》：「發昔夢於木禾兮，穀崑崙之高岡。」參見「崗」。

　　「岡」引申泛指山嶺、小山。如《楚辭．九思．哀歲》：「陟玉巒兮逍遙，覽高岡兮嶢嶢。」洪興祖補注：「山嶺曰岡。」《文選．陳孔璋〈檄吳將校部曲文〉》：「蓋鳳鳴高岡，以遠罻羅，賢聖之德也。」劉良注：「岡，山也。」

從「 山 」，「 网 」聲。本義是山脊。《說文》：「岡，山骨也。从山，网聲。」如《詩．周南．卷耳》：「陟彼高岡，我馬玄黃。」《毛傳》：「山脊曰岡。」《左傳．昭公三十一年》：「楚師遷潛於南岡而還。」《文選．張平子〈思玄賦〉》：「發昔夢於木禾兮，穀崑崙之高岡。」參見「 崗 」。 「 岡 」引申泛指山嶺、小山。如《楚辭．九思．哀歲》：「陟玉巒兮逍遙，覽高岡兮嶢嶢。」洪興祖補注：「山嶺曰岡。」《文選．陳孔璋〈檄吳將校部曲文〉》：「蓋鳳鳴高岡，以遠罻羅，賢聖之德也。」劉良注：「岡，山也。」
From " mountain" to " net" sound. The original meaning is ridge. "Shuowen": "Oka, mountain bones. From the mountain, net sound." Such as "Poetry. Zhou Nan. "Round Ears": "Zhibi Gaogang, I Ma Xuanhuang." "Mao Zhuan": "The ridge is called Gang." "Zuo Zhuan. "The Thirty-one Years of Zhao Gong": "The Master of Chu moved to Nangang and returned." "Selected Works. Zhang Pingzi's "Sixuan Fu": "The past dreams are in the wood and the high hills of Kunlun." See " Gang". " Gang" refers to mountains and hills by extension. Such as "The Songs of the Chu. Nine thinking. "Sorrowful Years": "Zhi Yuluan is happy, and you can see the gaogangs and ridges." Hong Xingzu's supplementary note: "The mountains are like the hills." "Selected Works. Chen Kongzhang's "Commemorative Songs from General Wu's Department": "Gai Feng Ming Gao Gang, far away and Luo, virtuous and saintly virtue." Liu Liang's note: "Oka, mountain."

岡字的基本解释

岡
gāng
见“冈”。

岡字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gāng］
［《廣韻》古郎切，平唐，見。］
亦作“崗1”。“冈1”的繁体字。
山脊；山岭。

岡字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【山字部】　岡； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页308第39
〔古文〕?【廣韻】古郎切【集韻】【韻會】居郎切，?音剛。【說文】岡，山脊也。从网从山，取上銳下廣形。【爾雅·釋山】山脊岡。【詩·周南】陟彼高岡。【小雅】如岡如陵。【五代史·唐紀】李克用破孟方立於郉州，還軍置酒三垂岡。　又【韻會】通作阬。【前漢·揚雄傳】?衆軍於東阬。【註】阬，讀作岡。　【韻會】說文本从山，俗又加山作崗，非。　【集韻】或作?。

岡字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
岡字的起名意思

同“冈”，有山冈，岗峦之义。

Gang
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［gāng］
["Guangyun" Gu Langqie, Ping Tang, see you. ]
Also known as "Post 1". Traditional characters of "冈1".
Ridge; mountain ridge.
Gang
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Yin Collection] [Mountain Character Department] 　冈; Kangxi Strokes: 8; Page Number: Page 308 Page 39
[Ancient text]? [Guang Yun] Gu Lang Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Ju Lang Qi,? Yin Gang. [Said the text] Gang, the ridge is also. From the net from the mountain, take the sharp shape from the top to the bottom. 【Erya·Shishan】ridge ridge. [Poetry·Zhou Nan] Zhibi Gaogang. [Xiaoya] Rugang Ruling. [Five Dynasties History·Tang Dynasty] Li Ke used Po Meng Fang to stand in Xingzhou and returned to the army to buy wine in San Chuigang.　[Rhyme Club] again, it's all for 阬. [Previous Han·Yang Xiong Biography] The army was in Donghu. [Note] 阬, pronounced as Gang.　[Rhyme Club] It is said that the text is from the mountain, and the vulgar adds the mountain to the post, and it is not.　【Jiyun】or make?.

Gang
Name meaning
Same as "Gang", it has the meaning of hills and hills.
gāng
вм. 冈
Radicals: 冂, 一, 山  (head, ground, mountain, horns)
Meaning Mnemonic
You have a scene going on inside your head. It is of a pair of horns on the ground atop a mountain. No. It is not just one pair of horns. It is many. So many that they create a giant hill atop the mountain, which is already pretty high.
Imagine this hill of horns on top of this mountain. This hill of horns makes it possible for you to get just high enough to touch the top of the sky.
Reading Mnemonic
How was standing atop this hill of horns on top of a mountain to touch the sky? Eh. It was okay (おか), but that's about it.
Feel indifferent about this hill of horns on top of the mountain. It's all in your head anyways.
